subject: Re: FW: Introduction - Elepay and Wolf IQ
preview: Hi Ben,  No worries at all!  Looking forward to revisiting Elepay integration in January.

full_threads.body:
Hi Ben,

No worries at all!

Looking forward to revisiting Elepay integration in January.

Hi Joy,

Thanks for providing the break down of costs. Hold for now, we will re-visit this in January

Regards,

Hi Ben,

Hope you're doing well!

Our hourly rate is A$147/hr (ex GST). Here are the details:

Total Estimated Time: 8 hours
Scope of Work:
  1. Replace the existing campaign flow
  2. Update the current codebase
  3. Conduct full functionality testing and deploy to production

Total: A$1,176 (ex GST)

Please let us know if you're happy for us to proceed, and we will prepare and send the invoice.

Hi team,

Can I get a response on the below so I can keep this moving please

Regards,

Hi Ben,

Hope you’re doing really well.

We have discussed the details with the Elepay team, and we really appreciate the API details and documentation that were shared.

@Ben, we’ve now completed our review, and we estimate the development work to take around 8 hours.
Please let us know if you’d like us to proceed, or if there’s anything you’d like to chat through before we get started.

The scope includes:
  • Replacing the campaign flow
  • Updating the existing code
  • Completing full functionality testing and pushing to production

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Have a wonderful weekend!

Hi Ben,

Hope you’re doing really well.

Julian, Paul, and I caught up a few weeks ago, and we really appreciated the API details and documentation you both shared — thank you again, it was incredibly helpful.

@ben, we’ve now completed our review, and the development work involved looks to be around 4–8 hours. Please let us know if you’d like us to proceed, or if there’s anything you’d like to chat through before we get started.

This scope includes:
  • Replacing the campaign flow
  • Updating the existing code
  • Completing full functionality testing and pushing to production

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Have a wonderful weekend!

Hi all,

I have just returned from leave, how are we going with this? Was a time booked for you both to catch up?

Regards,

👉 Book a time here

Hi Joy,

Following Paul's email. Would love to organise a quick catchup ASAP so that we are on the same page, and we can get the ball rolling with development. Elepay and (I'm assuming) Novari Collective are both keen to get the project completed within the next couple of weeks so that they can start offering.

Thanks!

Julian De Pasquale

Head of Client Success
julian@elepay.com.au

1300 019 417




DISCLAIMER: Please refrain from disclosing any personal information to Elepay via email. Kindly request a link to our Secure Upload Portal, where all your information is transmitted in the safest and most secure manner possible.

Hi Joy,

Could you please clarify if you need anything from us in order to complete that integration of updating proposal status and when it's accepted. Isn't it sufficient to update your status when the Accept Proposal event is captured on your site before forwarding to us?

Perhaps it would be good if we good have a discussion to review your process and the integration requirements. Could we please arrange a meeting at your convenience?

Thanks
Paul

Paul Gampel

Chief Technology Officer

0419 299 901
paul@elepay.com.au

1300 019 417




DISCLAIMER: Please refrain from disclosing any personal information to Elepay via email. Kindly request a link to our Secure Upload Portal, where all your information is transmitted in the safest and most secure manner possible.

Hi Paul,

Hope you have a lovely Monday!

Yes, everything looks good on our end. Just a couple of things we’ll need to support the integration on our side:

  • A way to detect when a proposal is accepted (e.g. webhook or callback)
  • A trigger we can use to update proposal status in our setup

Looking forward to reviewing the REST endpoint documentation.

Hi Joy

We would like to integrate the Novari Proposal process with our application system (eg. on https://mel-proposal.novaricollective.com.au/secure/?prop=RER4Rkp0RTJOSTVSM3FWUjYzMEVRUT09):



  1. The Novari proposal should remove payment details capture as this process is provided by our system;



  2. When a customer signs and clicks the Accept Proposal button your backend will post the data to our REST endpoint (with basic auth);



  3. The POST response will include a URL and QR code to our application system. The Novari proposal should redirect the client browser to our URL.



  4. Please confirm if you would need to track applications by staff member and office. We can configure that as well as part of proposal POST payload.



  5. Can you provide us with a test environment to create proposals and accept them for api testing ?



Please confirm this is acceptable and I will forward our REST endpoint documentation for your review.

Many thanks,
Paul Gampel
CTO
Elepay

Paul Gampel

Chief Technology Officer

0419 299 901
paul@elepay.com.au

1300 019 417

Hi Julian,

Hope you are having a great week!

We've extracted a sample of information that is entered during the proposal process. Please check if this is what we needed.

If not, we can work on creating a Loom video on the process.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

Hi Julian,

Hope you're having a lovely Friday!

Just a quick note to confirm we’ve received your Loom request and have it queued up.

We’ll send it your way early next week.

Let me know if there's anything else you need in the meantime!
